strings.Value: "Evil's voice can be strong, fearful — sometimes seductive in its corruption. But we must face it, no matter its voice, and stand against it."
"You never know where life's path will take you. But I would never harm someone intentionally for my gain — or another's."
"Creating a disaster or two is a small price to pay to gain the support of an arch-daemon."
"Enough with the moral lessons, Tristian. Let's move on."
{n}Tristian scans the chamber, his eyes wary.{/n} "This is… a dark place."

"These carvings on the walls… they are a chronicle of rituals. They depict the worship of the most depraved of creatures — the daemonic Four Horsemen of Apocalypse. Their followers serve the will of their masters — death and destruction."
"You are right. Forgive me. I'll control myself."

"Every disaster, every misfortune serves the Horsemen. Suffering and pain are what they treasure above all else. They see life as a harvest — and even knowing their nature, there are those who embrace horrific acts to gain the Horsemen's favor."

{n}Tristian nods slightly, frowning.{/n} "You are right. But there are times where doing the right thing... it is beyond our power." {n}He sighs, then casts a dark glance at the chamber.{/n} "We should leave this place."

{n}Tristian looks at you for a moment, then nods.{/n} "You are right. Sometimes life gives us obstacles we can't overcome without sacrificing a part of ourselves." {n}He looks around the room again, then shakes his head.{/n} "We should leave this place."

"The price of the suffering of others always seems insignificant, until you are the one thrown on the pyre for another's gain." {n}Tristian shakes his head.{/n} "I can already feel this place whispering to us. We should leave."
